conclusion: Determine the time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder.
The wooden rod is initially at rest and falls freely under gravity.
The distance from the suspension point to point A is 20 m.
Using the equation of motion for free fall: s = 1/2 g t^2.
Rearrange to solve for t: t = sqrt(2s/g).
Substitute s = 20 m and g = 10 m/s^2: t = sqrt(4) = 2 s.
The time for the rod to reach point A is 2 s.
The distance from the suspension point to point B is 20 m + 5 m = 25 m.
Using the same equation of motion: t = sqrt(2s/g).
Substitute s = 25 m and g = 10 m/s^2: t = sqrt(5) â‰ˆ 2.236 s.
The time for the rod to reach point B is approximately 2.236 s.
Calculate the time t1 for the rod to pass through point A: t1 = tB - tA.
Substitute the values: t1 = 2.236 s - 2 s = 0.236 s.
The time t1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder is approximately 0.236 s.
